intro: Pimpinella brachyclada, commonly known as the narrow-leaved cowparsley, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features slender stems and small, compound leaves that are typically hairy in texture. Its flowers are white or pale yellow and arranged in umbels, a characteristic feature of the family. Pimpinella brachyclada is often found in grasslands and disturbed soils, and it plays a role in supporting local insect populations.
